name: AstraZeneca
sponsors: AstraZeneca, University of Oxford, and its spinout company Vaccitech
discription: AstraZeneca is given as two injections, usually into the muscle of the upper arm. The second dose should be given between 4 and 12 weeks after the first dose.Arrangements for the supply of the vaccine are the responsibility of national authorities. For more information about using Vaxzevria, see the package leaflet or talk to a healthcare professional.

name: Sinovac
discription: The Beijing-based biopharmaceutical company Sinovac is behind the CoronaVac, an inactivated vaccine.It works by using killed viral particles to expose the body's immune system to the virus without risking a serious disease response.By comparison the Moderna and Pfizer vaccines being developed in the West are mRNA vaccines.

name: casirivimab
discription: It is possible that REGEN-COV could interfere with your body’s own ability to fight off a future infection of SARS-CoV-2. Similarly, REGEN-COV may reduce your body’s immune response to a vaccine for SARS-CoV-2. Specific studies have not been conducted to address these possible risks. Talk to your healthcare provider if you have any questions.

name: Moderna
discription: Moderna is given as two injections, usually into the muscle of the upper arm. The second dose should be given between 4 and 12 weeks after the first dose.Arrangements for the supply of the vaccine are the responsibility of national authorities. For more information about using Vaxzevria, see the package leaflet or talk to a healthcare professional.

name: Bamlanivimab
discription: It is possible that REGEN-COV could interfere with your body’s own ability to fight off a future infection of SARS-CoV-2. Similarly, REGEN-COV may reduce your body’s immune response to a vaccine for SARS-CoV-2. Specific studies have not been conducted to address these possible risks. Talk to your healthcare provider if you have any questions.

name: Veklury
discription: Veklury is an antiviral medicine used to treat coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). It is used in adults and adolescents (from 12 years of age and weighing at least 40 kilograms) with pneumonia requiring supplemental oxygen (low- or high-flow oxygen or other non-invasive ventilation at the start of treatment).
